title.narrative: Protection of women and children from the conflict affected and famine stricken populations including critical psychosocial support for children in the Equatorias, Unity and Upper Nile

description.narrative: The main objective of this joint project with UNICEF is to improve access to protection services (GBV, Child Protection) for women and children at risk from communities affected by the combination of severe food insecurity and conflict. In this joint project UNFPA will use CERF funds to 1) procure and distribute 14,400 dignity kits with the help of implementing partners and 2) procure and distribute 100 fuel efficient stoves (FES). 14,500 people in Fashoda, Koch, Leer, Mayendit, Panyijar, Kajo-Keji, Lainya, Magwi, Torit, Yei will benefit from this support for 6 months.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Protection of women and children from the conflict affected and famine stricken populations including critical psychosocial support for children in the Equatorias, Unity and Upper Nile

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS SOUTH SUDAN RAPID RESPONSE DISPLACEMENT 2017

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
